newsitem.title: IRAN: Iran warns of high pollution in Caspian Sea.
newsitem.headline: Iran warns of high pollution in Caspian Sea.

text.p: Iran warned of high pollution in the oil-rich Caspian Sea and called on littoral states to limit the effect of pollutants on marine life and public health, the official IRNA news agency reported on Sunday.

"Samples of water from the Caspian Sea coasts showed that there had been 61,840 cases of...microbial pollution in the water," it quoted Mohammad Hassan Pirasteh, director general of Gilan Provincial Environment Protection Organisation, as saying.
Pirasteh did not say when the samples were taken.
He said among the main pollutants were oil, pesticides and industrial sewerage.

He said states bordering the Caspian Sea -- Azerbaijan, Russia, Iran, Turkmenistan, and Kazakhstan -- should work together on measures to protect endangered marine life and limit health hazards to humans caused by eating contaminated fish.
